title: Single letter X for font identification
content:
Please can someone have a go at identifying this font from a single letter X. Someone has added some slits to it and I think it was originally solid. Any help or suggestions would be appreciated, thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725143457im_/http:/typophile.com/files/X_5725.jpg)
author: NoOneYouKnow

comments.content:
This is probably modified by lengthening the upper left & bottom right leg of /x.  
If this is the case, **[Ethnocentric](http://web.archive.org/web/20140725143457/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Typodermic&ffam=Ethnocentric%20-%20Regular&fid=482de819aa9631d27141f3d998cace18&fsize=60&text=x&fit=1)** by Ray Larabie [Typodermic, 1999] could be a good starting point [the regular & italic weights are free].
